goals.question: What is the trend of the S&P 500 index over time?
goals.visualization: Line chart of S&P 500 index over time
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the overall performance of the stock market and identify any long-term trends.

goals.question: What is the distribution of daily returns for the S&P 500 index?
goals.visualization: Histogram of daily returns for S&P 500 index
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the volatility of the stock market and identify any outliers or patterns in the distribution of returns.

goals.question: What is the correlation between the S&P 500 index and the 10-year Treasury yield?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of S&P 500 index vs. 10-year Treasury yield
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the relationship between the stock market and interest rates, which can have a significant impact on investment decisions.

goals.question: What is the sector-wise distribution of companies in the S&P 500 index?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of sector-wise distribution of companies in S&P 500 index
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the composition of the stock market and identify any sectors that are over or underrepresented.

goals.question: What is the distribution of market capitalization for companies in the S&P 500 index?
goals.visualization: Box plot of market capitalization for companies in S&P 500 index
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the size distribution of companies in the stock market and identify any outliers or patterns in the distribution of market capitalization.

code:
```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_csv('sp500.csv')

# Convert date field to date type
data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')

# Drop rows with NaT values
data = data[pd.notna(data['date'])]

# Create line chart
sns.lineplot(x='date', y='close', data=data)

# Set chart title
plt.title('What is the trend of the S&P 500 index over time?', wrap=True)

# Rotate x-axis labels for legibility
plt.xticks(rotation=45)

# Show chart
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_csv('sp500.csv')

# Compute daily returns
data['daily_returns'] = data['Close'].pct_change()

# Plot histogram of daily returns
sns.histplot(data=data, x='daily_returns', kde=True, color='blue')

# Add vertical line for mean daily return
mean_return = data['daily_returns'].mean()
plt.axvline(mean_return, color='red', linestyle='--', label=f'Mean return: {mean_return:.2f}')

# Add vertical line for median daily return
median_return = data['daily_returns'].median()
plt.axvline(median_return, color='green', linestyle='--', label=f'Median return: {median_return:.2f}')

# Add chart title and legend
plt.title('What is the distribution of daily returns for the S&P 500 index?')
plt.legend()

# Show plot
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_csv('sp500.csv')

# Convert date fields to date types
data['Date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')

# Drop rows with NaT values
data = data[pd.notna(data['Date'])]

# Create scatter plot
sns.scatterplot(x='10 YR', y='SP500', data=data)

# Add title and axis labels
plt.title('What is the correlation between the S&P 500 index and the 10-year Treasury yield?')
plt.xlabel('10-year Treasury yield')
plt.ylabel('S&P 500 index')

# Add correlation line
corr = data['10 YR'].corr(data['SP500'])
plt.axline(xy1=(data['10 YR'].min(), data['SP500'].min()*corr), xy2=(data['10 YR'].max(), data['SP500'].max()*corr), color='red', label=f'Correlation: {corr:.2f}')

# Add legend
plt.legend()

# Show plot
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

data = pd.read_csv('sp500.csv')

sns.set_style("whitegrid")
plt.figure(figsize=(12, 6))
sns.countplot(x='Sector', data=data, palette='viridis')
plt.xticks(rotation=90)
plt.title('What is the sector-wise distribution of companies in the S&P 500 index?')
plt.xlabel('Sector')
plt.ylabel('Count')
plt.show()
```

```
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load data
data = pd.read_csv('sp500.csv')

# Plot
sns.set(style="whitegrid")
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 6))
sns.boxplot(x=data['Market Cap'], ax=ax, color='lightblue')
ax.axvline(data['Market Cap'].median(), color='red', linestyle='--', label=f'Median: {data["Market Cap"].median():,.2f}')
ax.set_title('Distribution of Market Capitalization for Companies in the S&P 500 Index')
ax.set_xlabel('Market Capitalization (in billions of USD)')
ax.legend()

plt.show()
```
